title: Tech Behavior Interview
prompt: A professional job interview in a modern tech office. A confident female interviewer in business casual sits behind a clean desk with a laptop. She speaks directly to the camera as if the viewer is the candidate. Neutral lighting, corporate but friendly environment.

nodes.title: Welcome & Icebreaker
nodes.script: The interviewer smiles warmly and gestures to the chair. She says: 'Welcome! Thanks for coming in today. Before we dive in, tell me a bit about yourself and what brought you here.'

options.condition: Player gives a concise, relevant introduction covering their background and motivation for applying
Player rambles without focus, gives irrelevant personal details, or seems unprepared
Player is arrogant, dismissive of the question, or shows no interest in the role

nodes.title: Leadership Challenge
nodes.script: She nods approvingly and leans forward. She says: 'Great. Tell me about a time you led a challenging project. What was the situation and what did you do?'

options.condition: Player provides a specific example using STAR structure (Situation, Task, Action, Result) with clear leadership and impact
Player gives a vague or generic answer without specific details or clear personal contribution
Player takes all credit, dismisses team contributions, or gives a clearly fabricated story

nodes.title: Redirect — Focus
nodes.script: She tilts her head slightly, maintaining a professional smile. She says: 'Interesting. Let me ask you something more specific — can you walk me through a project you're most proud of?'

options.condition: Player recovers with a clear, structured answer about a specific project with measurable outcomes
Player continues to be vague or unfocused but shows some relevant experience
Player still can't provide any concrete examples or seems to be making things up

nodes.title: Conflict Resolution
nodes.script: She's visibly engaged, taking notes. She says: 'That's impressive. Now, in that project or another — how did you handle disagreements or conflict within the team?'

options.condition: Player describes a mature approach to conflict: active listening, finding compromise, focusing on the problem not the person
Player shows they avoid conflict entirely or escalate it rather than resolving it

nodes.title: Digging Deeper
nodes.script: She pauses, then says: 'I'd like to understand your approach better. Can you give me a specific example of a technical challenge you solved and walk me through your thought process?'

options.condition: Player provides a clear technical example with structured problem-solving and explains their reasoning
Player gives a surface-level answer without demonstrating deep technical thinking
Player can't provide any technical example or clearly lacks the required skills

nodes.title: Failure & Growth
nodes.script: She puts down her pen and looks directly at the candidate. She says: 'Tell me about a time you failed. What happened and what did you learn from it?'

options.condition: Player shares a genuine failure, takes ownership, and clearly explains what they learned and how they grew
Player gives a disguised success story as a failure, or claims they've never really failed
Player blames others entirely for the failure, shows no self-awareness or accountability

nodes.title: Pressure Question
nodes.script: She leans back slightly. She says: 'Let me put it differently. If you joined our team tomorrow and the main service went down, what would be your first steps?'

options.condition: Player describes a calm, systematic approach: check monitoring, communicate with team, isolate the issue, prioritize
Player shows panic, no structure, or unrealistic answers that suggest lack of experience

nodes.title: Why This Company
nodes.script: She smiles. She says: 'We're getting close to the end. Why do you want to work here specifically? What excites you about this role?'

options.condition: Player shows genuine knowledge of the company, connects their skills to the role, and expresses authentic enthusiasm
Player gives generic answers that could apply to any company, showing no research or real interest

nodes.title: Authenticity Check
nodes.script: She raises an eyebrow slightly. She says: 'I appreciate the positivity, but I'm curious — what's something you genuinely struggled with and how did it change your approach?'

options.condition: Player opens up with a real struggle, showing vulnerability and genuine growth
Player continues to dodge, gives another non-answer, or remains inauthentic

nodes.title: Interview Success
nodes.script: She closes her notebook and gives a warm, genuine smile. She says: 'This has been a great conversation. I'm impressed with your experience and how you think about problems. We'll be in touch very soon — I have a really good feeling about this.'

nodes.title: Interview — On the Fence
nodes.script: She nods politely. She says: 'Thank you for your time today. We have a few more candidates to meet, but we'll definitely be in touch with next steps.' Professional but non-committal.

nodes.title: Interview Failed — Attitude
nodes.script: She pauses, then closes her notebook. She says: 'Thank you for coming in. I think we're looking for a slightly different fit for this role. We appreciate your time.' Polite but final.

nodes.title: Interview Failed — Credibility
nodes.script: She stops writing and looks up. She says: 'I appreciate you coming in today. I'll be honest — I think there might be a gap between what we need and where you are right now. But I wish you the best.' Direct but respectful.

nodes.title: Interview Failed — Technical
nodes.script: She sets her pen down and sighs slightly. She says: 'Thank you for your time. The role requires a strong technical foundation and I think you'd benefit from more hands-on experience first. Let's keep in touch for the future.' Kind but clear.
